title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984
medium: Graphite, crayon, brush and red watercolor; black wash applied recto and verso on tracing paper.
dimensions: 19.4 x 20.3 cm (7 5/8 x 8 in. ), at widest point
description: Four panel screen in the form of four figure-like forms.  Upper part of four panels are irregular geometric shapes with triangular cut out in each panel. Upper edges and cut outs highlighted with colored crayons. Upper half of figures is white with green, pink, yellow, green, and blue shaded areas along upper contours and adjacent to triangular shapes on torsos.  Each figure wears black girdle with red and white striped skirts. This design is cut along outside contours from a larger sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984.
ca. 1984. Graphite, crayon, brush and red watercolor; black wash applied recto and verso on tracing paper.. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-295.
